title: Vsevolod Iakovlev
text:
CV
  

      
I’m a Research Associate in Economics at Heriot-Watt University, specializing in applied economics.
My current projects explore:

transport decarbonisation
educational and skill mismatch
gender wage gap
two-sided matching
applications of machine learning in economics


    
    
  



Research










Matched or Mismatched? Unpacking Gender Mismatch Gaps with Machine Learning


This paper investigates gender differences in labour market mismatch, specifically, over-education and over-skilling, using rich microdata from the OECD’s Survey of Adult…



V. Iakovlev, C. Tealdi


Jul 22, 2025














Skill vs. education types of labour mismatch and their association with earnings


Work in progress


This work aims to determine whether the difference between skill and education-based measures of labour mismatch affects the estimates of the labour mismatch-earnings…



V. Iakovlev


Dec 16, 2024














Using machine learning methods to estimate the gender wage gap


The Gender Wage Gap (GWG) is a classic topic in labour economics. Simply put, how do we explain the observed gap in earnings between men and women? Traditionally the GWG has…



R. Forshaw, V. Iakovlev, M. E. Schaffer, C. Tealdi


Jun 2, 2024














An introduction to stacking regression for economists


We present an introduction to “stacked generalization” (Wolpert in Neural Networks 5(2):241–259, 1992 [21]). The increased availability of “Big Data” in economics and the…



A. Ahrens, E. Ersoy, V. Iakovlev, H. Li, M. E. Schaffer


Jan 1, 2022

mismatch_toolbox


Labout Mismatch Toolbox for PIAAC


This package provides a set of functions designed to compute education and skill-based labour mismatch using data from the 1st Cycle of the Survey of Adult Skills (PIAAC).…

dap_mrs


Deferred Acceptance with Marginal Rate of Substitution


This module is a python implementation of the deferred acceptance procedure (DAP) developed by Gale and Shapley (1962). The algorithm computes an applicant-optimal…

Dec 11, 2024














toysimlm


Toy Microsimulation of Labour Mismatch


This module implements a simple microsimulation of labour mismatch based on a static version of the two-sided matching model developed by Zinn (2012). The purpose of the…
